description.@value: I just couldnât wait to get home today so that I could share a very special paleo dessert recipe with you guys. Whatâs so special about it? Well, itâs only just an out of this world coconut cream brownie ice cream recipe. Thatâs rightâbrownies and ice cream in one, so you can understand my excitement with this recipe. Itâs one of those recipes you never knew you were missing out on, but once you try it, itâll be there to stay. This is actually a dessert that you can freely enjoy on the paleo diet because it only uses all-natural ingredients. Cacao powder and dark chocolate chips bring the chocolatey goodness, while the coconut cream and honey provide a perfectly sweet ice cream texture when frozen. And to top it all off? The recipe even adds in some hazelnuts for good measure.

recipeIngredient.@value: 2 tbsp paleo friendly dark chocolate chips

itemListElement.@value: Add the coconut cream, cacao powder and honey to a high speed blender and blend until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to a loaf pan.
Let the ice cream thaw for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
Fold in the chopped hazelnuts and dark chocolate chips.
Cover and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
